I tried some English breakfast tea to finish my meal, it was average but the most disappointing part was how expensive the tea was. In terms of value, most of the dishes were reasonably priced, and portions were enough to satisfy you. 

With all these positive remarks, why just 4 stars? Service. The first two times we are here, the service was impeccable. The waiter was attentive and had good conversation. The busboys and servers were prompt and attentive. But the last time we went, our waitress was terrible. She was slow, only checked up on us once during the entire meal, and we had to chase her down to get our check. Other people in her area also had the same issues. While I wont hold this against the place for future visits, it did leave me a bit unhappy. 

Minus half a star for the service we got last time, and another half star for the rip off tea.

Wolfman Puke!!
Salad was spoiled to deterioration and waiter was overwhelmed. NEVER again!

I know that my reviews are usually tl:dr, but I'm going to make this one short and sweet:

1) It's in MGM...

2) it's one of the only restaurants in MGM that's open until 2am (and maybe later...we came in for "dinner" at 2am on a Friday night and they were open and surprisingly pleasant)...

3) The only way I could love this place more, is if they would be willing to move into my house and make that AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS "Caesar Salad" with the bib lettuce, humbolt fog cheese, and the white anchovies.  OMGZ YUUUUUUUUUUUUUUM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

EAT HERE.  EAT HERE NOW.

Great location, clean restaurant and good service...We had lunch there. The food was good, but lacked the 'Wow' factor. 
With so many succulent options to choose from in Las Vegas, the competition is extremely tough. We will try 'L'atelier de Joel Robuchon' next....

Walked in for a brisk dinner before our late flight back to NY. Waitress was friendly and efficient. The space was casually trendy. Slightly overprices but the pizzas are good and under $20. I went with Prosciutto (San Marzano Tomatoes, Goat Cheese, Mozzarella, Wild Arugula). 

Couldn't try the booze on account of impending chauffeur duty but was tempted. You're probably paying a few extra bucks for the Wolfgang name, but this is a nice, safe choice for lunch or dinner.

Went to the grill tonight for dinner. The service and the food were both horrible. If this is a premier restaurant of Wolfgang Puck. He should be thoroughly embarrassed.  I had a flat iron steak that was burnt on the outside, mostly well on the inside. Resembled beef jerky. No offence to beef jerky.  I had to flag down the waiter, Darren to have it done over. The second came out medium-well. Taste was horrible. A mound of blue cheese with some kind of sauce. I guess it was suppose to be demi. We also had a chenois salad. Bland other than the sesame oil. You might want to introduce your cooks to salt and pepper. All food was under seasoned. The chicken soup was fresh but again, no flavor. The bread was fresh. That was my dinner. I ordered an ice tea. Never received it. I had to ask for water. Twice. Even though two different servers came to our table to fix items. Darren spilled water on the table, never cleaned. It. This guy needs to be trained properly. He had way to many tables for his experience level. No manager in sight. No manager came over to apologize . Probably the main problem with service. We come to vegas several times a year. Won't be going to any joints with has the puck name.

"You better shut your mouth," I told him, trying not to sound like Brandon St. Randy. "That has to be a lie."

But no, my husband assured me he was telling the truth. If Yelp was to be believed, there was a Wolfgang Puck restaurant open until 6 a.m. We'd been burned by high-end late night dining before - places closed during dead times, menus more limited than even the limited ones advertised. But still, we are night owls, and we desperately want to believe in something other than cafe fare or Thai at 2 a.m.

"But it's Wolfgang Puck," I dithered. See, we had once watched Puck rather gleefully butcher a duck on a late night talk show. Mike and I love ducks. We don't eat ducks. We had decided right then that we didn't care for someone who could laugh while using a cleaver on one.

But we were also hungry. And, let's face it, all of our favourite chefs butcher ducks. We just don't happen to see them. And we do love trying new places...

"I'm not going to sit in some trendy high stool with my short legs swinging," I told Mike in the car. "And I don't want to deal with a bunch of clubbers talking loudly and importantly about their own awesomeness at the next table," I warned him. "And if it's loud, forget it."

We were shown to a comfortable (if slightly small) two-top in an unpretentious open area where we could watch casinogoers pass by. (Surprisingly, it wasn't noisy.) Even though it was just after 11, we got the full menu.

Mike began with the "Chinois Chicken Salad, Candied Peanuts, Crisp Wontons, Chinese Mustard Vinaigrette." I had a chopped vegetable salad. Mine was very nice, but Mike's salad got frothy adjectives from the first bite until, well, if you were to ask him about it now, I'm sure he could still give a five-minute talk on its virtues. They should schedule him for the next TED conference, honestly.

Mike continued his theme with the Crispy Chicken Milanese, declared to be "really, really good" (because he was out of words after that salad). I had a sort of mushroom Stroganoff with green beans, and I have to say "sort of" because it isn't on the online menu and I'm having to look at photos to jog my memory because my memory just refers to it as YUM YUM NOM NOM. 

I didn't scrape my plate clean, much as I wanted to, because everything was so delicious that we had to save room for dessert. (The leftover pasta made a fine lunch the next day. How often can you rave about the taste of the pasta and actually be referring to the noodle, not the entire dish? That's how good it was - I was gushing about the taste of the noodle itself!)

To reluctantly finish what was an unexpected taste bonanza, Mike ordered the caramelized lemon meringue pie (with blueberries). I ordered the cherry cheesecake with pistachios (also not on the online menu). We both then ordered our butler to kidnap Wolfgang Puck and force him to be our personal chef. (Because in the fantasy where we can afford Wolfgang Puck as our personal chef, we can also afford a butler. Although our true fantasy at this point was probably a private chauffeur, then we could've spooned in the back of the limo, basking in the afterglow of such a meal.)

I don't know if I can forgive Puck about the duck, but cognitive dissonance is no problem when your brain's being pumped full of happiness chemicals after a meal like this.

I was in Las Vegas for a stagette and this was our main planned dinner! I was quite impressed, the food was delish! I choose the steak skewers which were very good, I recommend asking for the wine sauce, it was much better than the one that comes with it. I was a bit disappointed that for $20 you only received 5 small bite sized pieces of steak- however I ordered the Yukon mashed potatoes with it and it was very good and tied it all together! 

Order the sangria! I highly recommend it.

Love everything about this place. The food is delicious, the ambiance is fun and welcoming and the staff is committed to top notch customer service. 

Definite recommendations
Apps: truffle chips, chili glazed wings, shrimp polenta pizza: mushroom pizza (a friend egg & sliced sheets of parmesan served on top), prosciutto
Entrees: Ribeye with Brussels sprouts and potato's (Brussels some of the best I've ever had) 
Desserts: Beignets are the best! Filled with nutella and a served with a banana cream dipping sauce.

Service is a pretty big influence on the experience overall and our server and bussed solidified the 5 stars. Robert, our server, was very personable and funny. He had some great suggestions as well.   Josh, our busser, was extremely polite, quick to clear any empty plates and/or ask if we would like refills.  I noticed two things he did that I have NEVER experienced before. The first was he a
sked for permission to clear the plate, he didn't only ask if we were done he asked if it was ok if he clear it. The second was when he was setting up for our desserts to arrive. He set the women first, then the children and then last the men. Old school manners that get noticed and go along way!!

I had the one of the best steak I have ever had in my life here and it was only 40$ It is the Grilled Top Sirloin that is served pre-sliced with lightly buttered garlic french fries on the side.
Our server was great and fast, there was always someone there to refill drinks and ask our status. 
Also, we had the house made donuts with beer dipping sauce and it was Mind Blowing! you could actually taste the beer but it was not overwhelming. 
My only recommendation is that you call ahead and ask for a table away from the casino.

What a pleasant surprise! This bar and grill in the middle of the gambling floor actually served wonderful food at reasonable (for Las Vegas) prices. The place was packed, but service was still perfect...friendly, yet efficient. He got us through dinner and out without rushing us, but in plenty of time for our show. They even had a kid's menu, a relative rarity for the Strip.

The steak skewer appetizer had nicely charred yet tender and juicy hunks of steak with a refreshing slaw on the side. I had been dying to try the Chinese chicken salad, a signature dish from Wolfgang Puck's flagship Chinois on Main...considering the huge portion, it was surprisingly light and refreshing. The Prime burger was huge, juicy , and perfectly done. The accompanying fries were the equal of any frites we have ever had...what was really nice was that they were scorching hot. Chicken fingers for the little one were gobbled up. And the one fine dining entree we chose was delicious...a pan-crisped sea bass fillet nestled amongst Mediterranean veggies in a light, flavorful broth. 

This place was a terrific choice for us, and will definitely be in our restaurant formation on our next trip!

There's not much open late night, or early morning, in MGM so our options were limited but Wolf Gang did the job. The service was great, our server was very friendly and attentive. The menu is nothing special ... Not too many original or unique options.... But we were newbs in Vegas and said screw dieting so why not each get a large pizza for ourselves ?! Hahaha we devoured them !! Nothing negative about the place but nothing too special either.

Sweet baby Jehovah. $7 to throw grilled chicken in a $14 salad? If I'd known I would've smuggled some of the stuff in my carry-on bag. I cut through the breast very carefully so as to not damage the freshwater pearl that must have been in there. I never found it.

That was my first night in Vegas. It was a wake-up reminder that I wasn't in Austin anymore. But Wolfgang's is the only sit-down place open after 10:30pm in the MGM. This means 2 subsequent visits, each more stellar than the first. Both exercised my economic know-how.

Visit 2: mussels with frittes. Yummmm. Huge serving, enough to share. But saying the word "share" is saying "charge me an extra $4.50 because I don't know what else to do with that money." Dumb. As the words were coming out of the boy's mouth, I knew we were toast. .. toast wedges came with the mussels... Hold on while I yummmm again.

Visit 3: we were golden. Linguine with clams for him, spinach side for me. Also known as: we SHARE both of those, in fact combining them for a delicious dish. They should include spinach in the linguine by default; it's all too pale otherwise. At $6 a spinach side, it was a way better deal than getting charged for sharing. 

And that's how you work the system, kids. Don't let them take you down. You wont win Vegas - you wont take my house, my money or my honey from under me. I'm from Jersey.

I stopped into Wolfgang puck late night to have a snack and sat by the bar. I ordered the truffle chips which were chips in a blue cheese sauce and I ordered the big eye tuna tartar. The blue cheese chips were good but the tuna tartar on the other hand that was a different story. As soon as it came out I could tell it wasn't fresh. The color of the tuna was dark almost with a purple tint. So i gave the benefit of the doubt and tried a bite, It tasted so fishy and rancid I spit it out. I won't be back for a while

I ate here for my birthday after seeing Ka Cirque du Soleil in the MGM Grand.

My husband and I were also staying at the MGM and didn't want to go far for a nice meal well we found it.

The restaurant is located right across from the theater and was very visible. We were immediately seated and greeted by our waiter.

 I am not really big into dining at franchise restaurants with famous executive chefs but I was pleasantly surprised with this one.

I ordered a burger with bleu cheese and was shocked at the beautiful presentaion, size and flavor. It was big enough where two people could share and be satisfied.

The side of fries were salty but decent. I mean there fries.

The prices were a little steep but remember you are paying for the name as well.

Overall, it was a memorable meal and a great end too my night at the MGM.

The food here is good! The pizza was good, fried chicken and steak skewers were all good the service was good and the whole place is pretty cute! Right after your done eating you can head over to a table or a slot machine! =)

I can sum up my experience like women's comparing of guy's units: falling short in expectations..Yeah sorry, that's all that came to mind.

I tried the world renowned blue cheese chips and in my view the salt in there was so overpowering that it did make it a bit unpleasant to get down and it didn't help either that they lost heat pretty quick. I did like the water if that counts?

Entree wise since it was lunch I went with a pizza and although I don't remember what I had exactly I do remember the taste and alas it tasted just like the name: a puck. Well maybe not that far, but it by no means has me coming back for more at all.

the food here was very delicious!!   for an amazing appetizer, try the shrimp pimento something or rather.... even the bread was great!   i ordered the alaskan halibut, and it was exactly as it should be.  trust this place is a great choice for dinner!

Night #2 in Vegas
I have 45 minutes until the show starts...my boyfriend is wasted...i'm hungry and annoyed.  From afar I spot a restaurant.  I make my way over to ask for a table, they're full, a 20 minute wait.  But there is a god, the manager entertained by my boyfriends antics makes room for us!!
We skim the menu and  quickly order (take notes):
Truffled Potato Chips, Maytag Blue Cheese Sauce
Mesquite Grilled Steak Skewer w/ House Steak Sauce
Sautéed Maine Crab Cakes, Tomato Relish, Basil Aioli

Extraordinary!!! Massive flavors in every bite!! I was absolutely impressed and I made it to the show on time and in much better spirits! Thank you Mr. Wolfgang Puck!!!!!

The caesar salad I had was just up to par, but the butter lettuce with blue cheese salad that my sister had was above and beyond.  I was wishing I had gotten that instead.  I had the veal ravioli with wild mushrooms- I loved that fact that it had morels in it.  So tasty.  And I normally am not a big fan of veal, but it wasn't overpowering and complemented the mushrooms in the sauce nicely.  The service was really good and our waittress was extremely friendly.  The bartenders were excellent at suggesting places to go afterwards.  Prices were fair- not too expensive compared to other restaurants in the MGM.  Overall a great find!

Great place to eat! We have one in Orlando but we haven't eaten there. The atmosphere was great and gsw won! We ordered the calamari and it came with like an avocado lime ranch dip. My BF ordered the salmon cooked medium with pork belly and peas! His dish was delicious. I ordered the wild mushroom rav. It was decent but I wish I would have ordered my bfs plate lol. I ate off his plate anyway :) to end our meal we ordered the ice cream sandwich which had caramelized bananas, brownies, NUTELLA and banana ice cream!!!!!  we tore it up! The server was awesome and we had so many refills on our water. We didn't have to wait long for our food. I looooooved this place! :)

A must eat place every time we are in Vegas. I've tried several dishes & am convinced they couldn't mess it up if they tried. The enviroment is lacking since it not closed off to the casino but the food makes up for it! !

I've eaten here twice now.  The first time was more meh.  I can't remember why, but I wasn't very impressed.  I went back this past week and I liked it a whole lot more.  I had the organic chicken.  The chicken was ok (needed a bit more seasoning) but the mashed potatoes and veggies were delicious.  I also tried my friends steak, which was awesome.  If I'm back in Vegas I'd go back, altho with all the different options, perhaps I should branch out a bit :)

If you are a fan of mussels or clams, I would highly recommend the "Steamed Black Mussels with White Wine, Garlic and Béarnaise ". The portion is huge, and was good enough to be shared among 3 people. Actually, we enjoyed it so much, we could have eaten another round! 

Otherwise, 3 stars because my group ate lunch here and there was nothing else to rave about. The wood oven pizza was seriously soggy, unless you like soft pizzas... and I wasn't a fan of my oily grilled panini either.

Wow, absolutely amazing. Good was great, I had the salmon- which was delicious. Calamari was also great, lightly battered and maybe a tiny bit salty but I like that. Creme Brûlée for dessert was awesome as well nice and soft and the sugar wasn't burnt like some places do. 

What's the best though? I don't think I have ever gotten better service at another retiring. My glass was never empty, and the waiter was very attentive, patient, and knowledgable (I asked about a lot of the dishes). If you're thinking about it- go for it!

Very good lunch fare.  Upscale casual with lots of delicious pizza options.  We had prosciutto and margherita pizza flavours to share.  The calamari, wings and steak skewers were delicious and flavourful.  Great friendly service, attentive and accommodating.

Ate here for lunch on our trip to Vegas. My Wife and I shared the pepperoni pizza and I ate the calimari starter. We loved it all. 

Also our server was awesome. Super friendly and very attentive, but not hanging around too much. 

We will deffently check this place out again on another trip.

just had dinner there with my wife. The food was amazing!! We had sea food linguini and prosciutto pizza. Was really one of the best i had. Highly recommended ! Will sure eat there again next time when ill stop in vegas.

I have been here numerous times and usually late at night. We usually sit at the bar and order drinks and some appetizers. The service is always so friendly and I never have a problem getting seats at the bar. The bartender Josh who usually who works the late night shifts makes the best dirty martinis I have ever had. The other bartenders there also do a fantastic job, they are just so friendly and the service is fast. 

The food is also amazing. I have had their chicken wings which is nice and crispy. Ive tried their potato puree and it is seriously addicting, I could eat just that as my meal.  I've tried their pizza which is tasty. 

It is located at the MGM and a bit of a walk to get here, but it's a great place to stop by after any concerts or after clubbing.

This restaurant wins all around.

The staff share the responsibility of all tables, so you are never begging for attention...or more of your beverage.

The food was yummy (we had a pizza, the crispy tuscan potatoes and a caesar salad)!

The design/layout is great.  It felt like you were in a swanky loft in NYC...normal kitchen islands, cabinetry, etc.

All of these for very reasonable prices.  Our total bill was less than $50, and that included 2 non-alcoholic (boooooring) drinks on top of the food mentioned.

Great place to eat if you're on the strip and hungry for a sit-down dinner with quality food!

Always made jokes about how I am not Wolfgang Puck in the kitchen. Well I am certainly not by any stretch. Food was absolutely unbelievable. Even the burgers were beyond compare. The Salmon with Cous Cous is amazing, Shrimp Scampi too. The service was brilliant too. If I could give more stars I would.

Came here for dinner before catching KA at the MGM Grand... Mr. Robuchon was calling my name, but we had no money to pay for it this time :)

It was packed but we had reservations and were seated quickly.  It's sort of sitting out in the middle of the casino but covered separately.  Standard WP fare - salads, oven baked pizzas, Californian menu... we enjoyed our meal, but it's nothing to write home about.  The bread was okay - I enjoyed the olive bread in particular, but the rest was average.

We both had the Caesar salad with bruschetta to start, and I had the sausage pizza and my hubby had the gnocci.  The salads were decent, and the pizza was quite good - nice thin crust, non-greasy with the nice oven taste.  The gnocci did not have enough gnocci... there was a ton of the sauce left-over afterward.

I think the quality is fair for the price... it's mid-range for price and also for quality.

Many Vegas restaurants compete for glitz and glamour, so it's a real treat to be able to dine at a restaurant simply for it's homestyle comfort foods, and that's what Wolfgang Puck Bar and Grill brings to the table time and time again!

Simple classics such as freshly made potato chips are dressed with truffle oil and a blue cheese dressing. Veal ravioli is gently tossed with mushrooms, brown butter and crisp sage.  A crispy chicken milanese is set apart with an arugula salad and cherry tomatoes.  And dessert is simply divine: a banoffee (banana and toffee) cream pie with a sugar dough shell, and bruleed bananas; a sorbet trio served in a brandy snap cup and topped with fresh berries.

Service needed slight improvement, granted the floor (both restaurant and casino) were busy, but the food should definitely be on everyone's checklist of things to see and do while on the Strip.

Calary and beef were both excellent, we really enjoyed it. The place and service were above expectations and it is one of our favorites in vegas!
Hope to come again :)
We went here for lunch and had exceptional service!  The food was delicious and the beer selection was awesome. We will definitely be back.

Typical Wolfgang Puck establishment ... stick to the strong points: thin crust pizza, simple pastas and California-esque Italian salads and you're gold.  We stopped for an aftershow dinner following the 19:30 Ka show.

I had the spaghetti and meatballs with a side of grilled asparagus and it was great ... lots of food, comfort food at that, and nothing to be disappointed about.  Admittedly nothing spectacular, but overall filling, pleasing and hit-the-spot tasty.  I also recommend the chicken wings, sweet glaze with a nice chili burn. 

My companions had the chopped vegetable salad (looked great), a simply fantastic looking Cabrese salad with a startling assortment of heirloom tomatoes and a brace of thin crust pizzas that smelled terrific.  Everyone in my party were pleased with both the food and the service.

DON'T WAIST YOUR TIME!!!!!The only restaurant still open at the MGM after 10:00 PM. My sister and I ordered a salad and it was over whelmed with raw onion.  So all I could taste was onion.  So I told the waitress that the salad was over whelmed with onion and I couldn't eat it.  She had a attitude so I just decided not to reorder anything.  Then the manager came and try to fix the situation and offered me something else.  So I decided to get chicken noodle soup.  That's pretty basic it hard to mess up soup so I thought.  It was flavor less and there was veins threw out the chicken.   I was done at that point and grossed out.  You would think that a restaurant of that stature would make sure there food was Delicious.  The whole time we were eating the waitress was giving us attitude.  Big mistake,  I would have left you a great tip after all your not the cook idiot!

Puck Bar & Grill AKA You can get better prices for the same kind of food, (but you're drunk and in Vegas, how would one know the difference?)

Unfortunately, the MGM restaurant scenario is starting to require you to win some money at craps or Blackjack, so that you can afford their dinners. This place is nice and the least expensive between the restaurants of the hotel. However, I don't think it's anything that special. The food is good and cooked well, but $25 for a plate of pasta feels a bit much, don't you think? The service was good and the decor is nice as well. But you turn the eyes and you're still next to a gambling table...I can't really make up my mind on this place. It's average...I would call it an upscale version of a Cheesecake Factory with some better cooking!

Big Thank You to our waiter James for incredible and attentive service. "You don't need flour to have fun" hahaha! You made us laugh from the get go we were so happy! 
Big Thank you to Chef Matt for personally coming out to talk to me about my entree options given that I am gluten and soy free due to allergies. I ate the most delicious Flat Iron Steak with cauliflower and Brussels sprouts...they were so understanding and accommodating and made my experience so comfortable. 
We are the biggest fans of Wolfgang Puck and we are here three times a year...this experience even exceeded perfection. I love you all at Wolfgang in MGM! Will see you in March!

Value for dollar, great deal for Las Vegas. My family and I spent an entire week at the MGM Grand, and we ended up eating here several times during our stay. This place had well rounded and balanced menus for both kids and adults. I loved the potato chips, and bacon blue cheese burger. I will say that we had one issues with a bar tender who was very rude, but the manager Brad was over the top accommodating. Not only was he receptive, but he immediately took care of it. He asked me to please come and dine again, and we did. He made up for the rude bartender and truly made the Wolfgang brand proud. We will now be seeking out Wolfgang restaurants any time we r in Vegas. Thanks Brad!!

Disclaimer- This review only applies to the bar (no food was ordered)--went here while waiting to get into Ka at MGM.

Specialty cocktails are $10 a piece and have a lot of potential.  That being said, after trying two: The Flirtini (how could I resist?? I love Sex and the City!) and the Pear Drop, I was left disappointed.  Having bar-tended before using the free-pouring method, my bartender here consistently under-poured, despite the generous tips after every round.  Any martini (such as the two I ordered) should not have fruit/sweet n sour as its dominant flavor.  I would have loved to give more stars but when the drinks are weak, what can you say? 

How about this: stick to their beer. They have Stella and Newcastle on draft, which alone should warrant a few stars!
Had the mushroom ravioli with some drinks. The drinks were ok but the ravioli was really greasy (not cheesy) ,weird and way overpriced!! Really bad experience:(

After a long day in Vegas we checked in to the MGM Grand and were looking for a casual restaurant close by to eat at. Although I have heard his (Wolfgang Puck) name throughout the years many times, I have never ate at any of his restaurants or had any of his frozen meals. I ordered the mussels and were very surprised when they came because there had to be 50+ mussels on the plate. They were good (but not great). My kids had the Spicy Meatball Pasta (it was a little to spicy for my son although he does like spicy foods) & the Homemade Spaghetti (daughter loved it). My wife had a steak which was good but did not leave a lasting impression. The service was great until it was time for the check when we didn't see our waiter for 15 mins.
Bottom line is that Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill is a nice casual place to get a bite to eat (at the MGM Grand), just don't expect to be blown away by the food. 3 1/2 stars.

it's not a 5 star restaurant, so don't expect 5 star service, but it's pretty upscale. I thought it was a bit pricey for a bar and grill - we ended up paying well over 300 bucks, and no we did not order lobster or champagne, but the food is excellent!

This place is the perfect example of overpriced food. 

You would think that a restaurant named after a recognized chef would be somewhat satisfying right? Well wrong, not here. My experience at Wolfgang puck was one where I wished I went to shake shack down the street instead of wasting my time and money here.

For all the entrees on the menu, they are priced from 25-40, so you expect something you would get out of a 4 star restaurant. Unfortunately what you get here is flavorless food that is dry and underwhelming in all aspects. I feel like whoever is cooking the food just puts it on the grill and wishes for the best. There is no seasoning on the food at all. The food that I was putting my mouth was like a large solid of nothing; my water had more flavor than the food and my water only had one lemon in it. 

I am in no attempt trying to bash this place at all but if you are presented as a "fine dining" restaurant then serve food like one.

Wolfgang doesn't disappoint. Another plus is they close really late basically the only place in MGM that is open past 2 am. Really great for those late vegas nights and late munchies. 

Stayed at the MGM for a conference so kind of didn't want to go far. This place is good. We had a lunch event here and the food was decent. For the late night I came back to have spaghetti and meatballs which was good. The meatballs are so huge! Definitely worth it.
Seabass and Gulf Shrimp with tomato-saffron broth was pretty good. Gulf shrimp yummy, but could have undercooked the seabass a little more. Vibrant crowd, okay service
Was really happy here. The food was great. Service attentive but not overbearing. Convenient hours - 11:00am to 6:00am.

Really disappointed!!!  When we walked in we started on a great note.  The hostesses were friendly and a few of the servers smiled warmly and greeted us as we ere escorted to our table.  Our server came over right away bout didn't offer any suggestions or any of his favorites or anything.  I have to assume that he wrote us off right away because we are in out 20's and he assumed we wouldn't tip him well.  There were 3 other tables seated after we were in the same servers section.  All had their drinks and bread on the table and had ordered their dinner before we were even asked for drink orders.  We sat with menus to the side ready to order for 15 minutes while our server stood across the restaurant from us and talked with another server. My husband started with chicken soup. The veggies in it were crips and fresh but the soup was rather bland.  I ordered the salmon with fingerling potatoes and spring peas and a stone ground mustard sauce.  The salmon was to be cooked to medium.  The salmon arrived and was served on a plate full of frozen peas and carrots and there were 3 halves of fingerling potatoes on the plate.  I have seen ahi tuna filets cooked more than my salmon was.  Only the outer 1/8th inch of the flash was cooked, the rest was Luke warm at best and totally raw.  There was a wait assistant near our table filling water for us and others and he checked with us right after our food was dropped and asked if we needed anything else he was polite and friendly.  Our waiter stopped by about 5 minutes later and didn't actually ask how things were just said " things are good here, ya?" and walked away.  Over all I was totally disappointed with the experience.  I have had better food and service at Applebees (which is total garbage)

It was okay; if I were Wolfgang Puck though, I wouldn't put my name on it.

I was very glad that it was open at 4am because it saved my butt from being hung over the next day after my first night in a recent visit to Vegas [bachelor(ette) party].

We shared the calamari (pretty good, nothing special) and a pizza.  No real complaints, but nothing above average gastropub food.  The pepperoni they used seemed home-cured and freshly sliced, though - I'll give it that.  We were really stuffed by the end of the meal - but it was worth it in order to not feel ill the next morning. :)

Service was great.

We ordered the truffled potato chips w/blue cheese sauce, Chinois Chicken Salad, mushroom pizza, Grilled Prime Burger, and Sautéed Seabass. First off, everything was too salty. If you like your food very salty, then it's okay, but for us, it was a bit too much. The food could've been better if everything didn't taste like salt. The truffled potato chips and the mushroom pizza were the best from what we ordered. But again, disappointed that the food could've been a lot better than it was.

Walking in, and it has a light and cozy atmosphere. Service was good and quick, perhaps because we came at 2:00 am. 

We ordered the Calamari and Gremolata aioli. This was my favorite. The Ricotta Gnocchi was not very appetizing for me. I disliked the taste it had. It tasted like vomit.. So I just gave it to my friend. I ate more of the Flat Iron Steak. That was tasty.

For what it is, I actually really like this place. I've been to many types of Wolfgang restaurants, and this is pretty solid Vegas food as far as I'm concerned. 

They're open almost 24/7 (okay 6am is pretty 24/7 to me!) and they're located in the MGM which is just a sprawling mass of activities and food alike. 

I've gotten various things there from steak, to sandwiches, to fries. Nothing was amazingly standout, but nothing was terrible or bad or even average. Everything was pretty good and the service was amazing even at 3am. 

I would highly recommend this, but only if you're staying in MGM. I definitely would not uber or taxi here in the middle of the night, it's not worth the drive!

Enjoyed our meal at this place so much we came back three times during our stay. Tried the calamari, pizza and hamburger.  Hamburgers are excellent, huge fresh and cooked well done as requested.  I would suggest splitting one among 2 people they were that big.  Appetizer, calamari was just ok, pizza was a bit undercooked for my liking I prefer well done.  Service varied but adequate most of the time.

I had a great experience here!

I ordered a sea-bass catch-of-the-day special. The tastes and textures were exquisite -- perfectly crispy on the edges -- perfectly tender throughout. Furthermore, I found the presentation and portion sizes to be very impressive.

There's a lot of attention to detail here:
- free wifi
- delicious bread selection
... and so on ...

There are not many places in Vegas that offer real value anymore -- this is one exception.
Atmosphere and food is good. They could use a little more staff especially in the bar area where they have a difficult time keeping up with customers.

This place is ok. We sat at the bar and had appetizers and bloody marys. We had the fried calamari and antipasti platter. The platter needs a few more slices of bread to break up all the tasty meat. The calamari and dipping sauce were fantastic. A bit overpriced, but so is Vegas now a days.
I liked the atmosphere very much.  I felt really nice sitting there dining near the theatre.  Aside from the wait for a table, everything else was excellent (including the food and service).

Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill (MGM)
Las Vegas Strip, NV
10pm Tuesday 6th August 2013
Four Stars


I was very impressed by the food and service.  We were given water and bread upon sitting down.  There were three types of bread (Olive, Rustic, and Cheese).  The 2012 Elk Cove Pino Grigio from Willamette Valley had a definite crispness and acidity with a touch of sweetness.  The chopped Salad  had Feta Cheese, Garlic Croutons, Tomatoes, Black Olives, Pickled Okra, and Creamy Greek Dressing.  It was light and refreshing and was not overpowered by the olives. The Spaghettini was simple but well executed.  The house-made al dente noodles acted a perfect vehicle for the plum tomato, basil, and garlic marinara sauce.  The Grilled Shrimp Capellini with Jumbo Shrimp was similarly delicious.  The Shrimps were a little over but the pasta and spicy sauce hit the spot.

We dined here several times but lately it appears they might've added more tables in an already congested space. We had a table in the center and the two different waiters hit me while serving the next table due to lack of space. The food is pretty good, but the service could be a little better. Overall  a four star rating was the best I could do.

Im not normally a Wolfgang Puck fan.  From the Canadian perspective, Wolfgang Puck is the epitome of failure in the restaurant industry.  His restaurant in the GTA failed, his line of soups can oven be found in the clearance bins at the grocery store, and his line of over-priced sandwiches in airports are a joke.

So when a salesrep offered to take me to Wolfgang Pucks Bar & Grill I was a little trepidatious.

Its a very open concept restaurant in the heart of the gaming floor near the Cirque du Soleil store.  We were looking for a casual dining experience and that's what we got.

As an appetizer we started off with mac and cheese and a house salad shared across the table.  The Mac and cheese was awesome.  The cheese was creamy with a distinct flavour.  If my 6 year old were present even he would have loved it.

For the entree I had the wood-fired chicken pizza.  I picked it because it had a number of veggies on the pizza as well.  It tasted good going down.  The portion size was quite filling.  I couldn't finish the last slice.

This visit left me with my opinion of Wolfgang Puck increasing favourably.

My husband and I dined here on 3-2-16. We were seated promptly! Our order was taken within 10 mins or less! Soon after our order was taken a table to the right of us another was seated and served their meal in less than 20 minutes! Meanwhile we waited over 40 minutes for our food to arrive! At no time at all did the waiter come over and apologize for the dealt! Therefore, we got up and were ready to leave and here come the waiter with our food! We decide to stay what the heck we waited this long! My husband ordered the mushroom pizza and it was delicious! I ordered the Prime burger and there was nothing Prime about it! The bun was burnt and the burger was dry as heck! The manager came over and offered us dessert and we declined and he comped by not so Prime burger, which was nice! Long story short your safe with the pizza but don't order the not so Prime Burger!

Enjoyed lunch here with my husband while visiting Vegas this past weekend. My husband enjoyed the burger while I enjoyed the apple salad. Service was pleasant, professional, and right on time. The food was delicious. The burger was very tasty with fries that were so crisp they practically snapped! My salad was fresh and perfectly dressed. I hate when a salad is over dressed. I did get chicken breast to go with my salad and it was a bit overseasoned to the point of being too salty. 

All in all, this was a fun restaurant and a good dining experience but just remember, you're paying casino floor prices..so don't get sticker shock when the bill arrives.
We played musical tables 4 times because everywhere we sat was reserved for someone "more important" than us. I was unaware that my money was any less important

Solid place to eat. Got the gnocchi, long beans and burger. Food wasn't too memorable or inventive, but it defiantly wasn't bad by any means. Expediting was done exceptionally well. The customer service of the staff especially Kyra & Hugo pushed this experience to 4 stars. She even split our meal on two plates without us having to ask; seems small but we always end up sharing and mention it and almost no place does it even when asked.

Got the blue burger which was a pretty darn good burger. I am not the biggest fan of fries, but they were thin and crispy and had almost no taste of grease which made them good. My boss got the french onion soup and short rib special which he absolutely loved. I have eaten here in the past and also left happy, if not for the slow ordering service it would get 5 stars, but they were very good and making sure we had utensils and refilled drinks.

Went here for lunch. There was ample seating available. Had the chicken breast entree . The chicken was moist and had a very crispy skin. The mashed potatoes were excellent. It also came with kale, which was in a salty sauce with onions. Overall it was a good meal for the lunch options at the MGM

Came here for dinner before seeing Ka, and it was okay. Each table gets free bread to start- the bread wasn't warm, which is fine but I'd prefer warm! We asked our waiter for some olive oil for our bread instead of butter, and he said he'd bring it but he ended up forgetting and we had to ask someone else. For entrees, my boyfriend ordered the sea bass and I ordered he agnolotti. We were surprised that the portions were a lot smaller than we had expected for the price, and this being a 2 dollar sign restaurant. The food was tasty, there just wasn't enough of it. We ended up getting a Chinese chicken salad to split to supplement. The salad actually was huge! They came out on separate plates to begin with so I don't know how large the full salad order actually is, but we were happy with this portion. Looking over at another table, the pizzas look like a decent size too. We decided that if we came back and got a salad and a pizza to split, that would actually be a good deal, so this place can be worth it if you know what to order! Other thing that helps is this place is literally across the room from the entrance to Ka, so if you're planning to see the show, it's super convenient! Overall, I probably wouldn't seek this place out unless you need to be somewhere in the MGM and want a salad and/or pizza!
The chinois salad was good. The burger that my boyfriend had was AMAZING!! The service is very good

Just because this is a cafe by one of the US's favorite chefs, and just because they spend time in the kitchen prepping the food and making it look fantastically gorgweah, doesn't mean it tastes good.  And it did not taste good. The chicken drumettes had almost no meat. Blech. The tuna tartare was nice enough but lacked zing.  Yawn.  The truffle and bleu cheese potato chips tasted good but they also tasted confused.  Choose one intense flavor to focus on, but not both.

I am giving them 3 stars because we got great service and our bartender was both a gentleman and patient with our drunken hazing.  I will got there again because it is convenient, but not because I like the food.

loved the freshness and cleanness of the place!! 
servers were very nice!! 
and they recommended couple dishes for us!!! 
got this really good almond champagne mmhmm!!

My favorite stop at MGM. Always a great break from the madness. You can get a small meal or a big meal at the bar and be very happy with the outcome. Great service there and great choices of food. They have a magic formula here that works. I ate there about 3 times last trip and it's where I tell people to meet me if I have to. Good spot

I think calling this an upgraded TGIFriday's may be unfair, but that's my analogy.  You get a menu full of options and the food is pretty good.  I feel you are paying for the Wolfgang name though as it is pricy.  The restaurant is middle of the MGM casino with no walls so the atmosphere is loud and the sounds of slots is prevalent.  If I'm going to pay a high price, I really don't need the sounds of penny slots and loud patrons.
Came here after a concert at MGM...service was excellent, food was great and we got to sit near the band members we had just seen and got a couple of autographs..how cool was that.

I have eaten at other Wolfgang Pucks before. Toronto, Orlando, and in Las Vegas. But Las Vegas was the best experience ever. My wife and I both truly enjoyed our experiences. I ordered the a chk sandwich and the Spicy Mule and my wife ordered the Rigatoni and Bluberry and peach Ice tea. For me the Spicy Mule was better than my chk sandwich and my chk sandwich was a 10/10. Def going back.

I have to say, there are two items on this menu that come to mind.

Number one, the spaghetti and meatballs.  Four meatballs, and a nice portion of al dente spaghetti (Not a huge plate, but not a little tiny amount like some of the restaurants on the strip).  I'm not gonna lie, the dish is very comforting.  It's rare to find dishes like this at hoity toity (sp?) strip restaurants.

Number two, the octopus salad.  The dressing is some sort of lime and chili concoction I believe.  Delicious well thought out appetizer.  

Good food if you are near crystals, you can get a decent meal and leave feeling full.  I like that!

The food was very good, but the kitchen was outrageously slow at lumch.  Over one hour from order to delivery.  The manager came over to tell us the food was coming out "soon," but did not offer an apology or compensation.

We stopped in here for a snack and were pleasantly surprised. 

The whole menu is a bit pricey, so I'm taking a star away. 

The Tuna tartare appetizer is a deconstructed spicy tuna roll sans rice with some seasame chips. It was excellent and quite a large portion. We also had the calamari which was lightly breaded in panko and was cooked perfectly. The aioli that is served with it is excellent. I highly recommend both. 

Service was excellent. I recommend, just be ready to fork over a benjamin.

Homemade truffle potato chips???! 

Ok you got me at truffle. I'm down to go! Anything truffle is gonna be bomb dignity! They are located at the MGM and open at 1130am. 

Our server had a very nice voice, let's hope we hear him on the radio! It's quite soothing. The kind of voice you want to hear tell you a story.

My travel buddies and I had wine and beer. We shared the homemade truffle potato chips which was SO GOOD! They recommended well! 

We also shared a tomato carpaccio salad, a pesto linguine pasta with clams and then shared a cheesecake. It was perfect! Content enough but not too full! 

I definitely come back next time.
My boyfriend and I stopped by before seeing Ka and had appetizers and beer. The calamari was delicious as well as the wing we ordered. Service was impeccable. I suggest this place for sure.

Went to Wolfgang Puck's on a Tuesday evening with my mom. We were greeted by friendly staff and immediately seated. The servers and bussers were very attentive and kind. We ordered the baby iceberg lettuce salad, which we were offered to split. This was the perfect size for us. The salad was fresh, yummy and had loads of cheese. We also split a Margherita pizza. The crust was light and crispy. The sauce had a really nice taste. We really enjoyed eating here and would definitely recommend it!

Lunch on Wednesday, 8/5/15 (first time visiting)

While we were staying at the MGM hotel, it was convenient to grab lunch downstairs before our next venture. There was no wait in line. The hostess immediately sat us down. Throughout our meal, the servers came by frequently to make sure we had everything we needed and that our food was alright.

We ordered the shrimp-style fettuccine and the rigatoni with whipped ricotta cheese. They were both tasty made with good quality ingredients. The fettuccine had some of the shrimp taste embedded in it too. While I was enjoying my rigatoni, you can taste the hearty meat sauce and delicious cheese in it. I expected the rigatoni pasta to be longer but it was served as a short tube.

When we were almost done with our meal, the server brought over the dessert menu. The list of options looked delicious but we were too full after our entree. They also close at 6am so my options were open if I had that late night craving.

Everything was great although pricey. What can I say, it's Vegas. I would come back again to try other items on the menu. Until next time.

This place is awesome , I wish I can do 10 stars , friendly, pros, food Is more than great , price is so reasonable, and most important if James on shift then you are LUCKY he is the best !! Thank you guys for the great host. You earn every star .

If you get in late to Vegas, this is the place to come and eat. It's rare that if you want to find a modern American flair restaurant the options are scarce after 11:00pm. The restaurant in located in the casino- open air and open kitchen floor plan. The food variety  ranges from salads, pizza, burgers, steaks and chicken. It's located at the MGM.

Service was friendly and delightful. Our server offered to do half portions for my soup and salad, which was perfect. My boyfriend had the breakfast sandwich, to which he added tomato and lettuce and, honestly, this might be the best breakfast sandwich of all time. The eggs were soft scrambled, the sausage was unbelievably good (made in house) and there was a wonderful remoulade style aioli on soft delicious bread. Can't say enough about it... really, the sandwich was incredible.

Love the fries here, sOo yummy, thin and crispy with seasoning. 
The steaks here are made just right. Not over cooked & just enough red & blood. Just the way I like it. The steak burger is good if you like onions. I think the onion flavor is overpowering. It makes me thirty afterward. The clam pasta is good. It would be better if they clean the clams a bit better. Had a few clams with sand/ dirt a few times already. sigh. The mussel pasta gets boring after a few bites.

One of my favorite places on The Strip. I eat here every single time I'm in Las Vegas, and last time, I ate here twice. Wolfgang Puck's gets kudos for an extensive gluten-free menu, convenience, and great customer service.

You're not going to find exquisite delicacies here. You're going to find standard American fare but done really well. I'm a fan of the gluten-free pizza. The prices are about what you'd expect for a named-chef restaurant on The Strip, but if you play MyVegas online, there's usually some sort of a meal discount you can snag from there.

The restaurant has an open layout, so you're going to be able to see the casino floor and Ka theater from wherever you sit in the restaurant. DINE HERE BEFORE THE SHOW GETS OUT. There's a huge rush afterward. Mid-late afternoon has always been a great time to get a meal here in my experience, and you can also eat late night.

This was our first meal in Vegas--we arrived around 11 pm and needed someplace open late. This place, while still pretty full, was able to seat us immediately and serve us quickly.

I had the cranberry mojito which was really delicious. Were they not somewhere just short of $15, I could have easily ordered another...and then another. The husbo and I decided to have appetizer dinner and shared the truffles potato chips, the chicken wings, and the steak skewers. Everything was good, with the skewers being the standout. The only real downside with the food was that it all cooled down a lot after just a couple minutes. Maybe if the plates had been warmer or the food hotter, it wouldn't have been as much of an issue. 

It wasn't a cheap meal, but nothing is in Vegas. Our server was really friendly and quick and someone else was doing a great job keeping our dirty plates cleared and our water full. All in all, lukewarm food aside, it was a good first meal in Vegas.

We were drinking at the MGM Grand casino bar area and it was getting late, so we decided to get some grub grub. The bar tender told us that Wolfgang Puck's kitchen is open the latest. So we walk over to get us something to put in our bellies to soak up all that alcomahol.

I ordered the tuna tartare which was probably the highlight of my night. I'm trying to find a picture of this dish, but I guess I forgot. But I do remember the taste and it was definitely sublime. I also remember smashing the heck out of it.

My two friends went with the Bacon Mac and Cheese. I remember trying it out when they asked me if I wanted taste. It was definitely quite good. Prolly one of the best Mac and cheese I've ever had.

Ok, so I'm now a believer. Wolfgang Puck is actually a pretty good restaurant. I've always wondered and never really had the inkling to try this chain out, but now I know. Good food, good service and good company.

Thank you so much for reading my review. I hope this helps with your decision making experience. Enjoy your awesome yelptastic day!

This particular Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill is a sufficient eatery located in the MGM Grand Casino & Hotel. Late diners beware that it closes at 10 on weekdays, and if you walk in anytime near closing, you won't even e seated at a restaurant table. We walked in around 9:30 and were told the bar seats were our only option. No problemo, we are simple diners and just needed a quick bite after a long, arduous day in Sin City.  

As a self-described brussel sprouts aficionado, I would say - DO NOT order the Brussels and Bacon. They were glazed with some type of sweetish sauce that was just not good. I took one bite and then decided that I would reluctantly pick out and eat all of the bacon (which my friend didn't seem bothered by). Then I just prodded and pushed the sprouts all around the plate, which is when our bartender seemed to take notice. He asked how things were and we gave him our honest response and he offered to remove them from our bill - an offer that we happily accepted. 

The Wolfgang Cabernet was delicious and paired well with the Rigatoni that I ordered. Michelle had the mushroom ravioli which she said was good (I took her word for it because I loathe mushrooms). 

Those with gluten allergies will happily enjoy Wolfgang's gluten-free menu, and those looking for a quick bite to eat in a no-frills version of an "upper scale" dining spot should be satisfied with Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill!

Now, I guess you can say that my judgement here was a little skewed because I ate here at 2:30 in the morning after coming back from Haze, the new nightclub in Aria (XS is better) and I was lightweight faded, but man was the food good.

We started out with the Truffled Potato Chips with Maytag Blue Cheese and man, this sh*t was bomb!  I normally don't like blue cheese at all, but it must have been a really good grade because it tasted great and didn't smell at all.  

After we shared the Spicy Soprasata, Salami Toscana and Pepperoni with Green Chilies Pizza and this even topped the chips!  If you've ever read my reviews or been to Gaspare's and ordered the Bruce's Special, you're gonna love this pizza.  Not as good, but great in its own way because it's different.  

Didn't have any trouble with slow service like other reviewers stated, but we did sit at the bar and took it back to the room.  Bartender was very friendly and made sure we always had water, lol.

I am definitely looking forward to coming here again and sampling items apart from the late night menu.

I know Wolfgang has a few restaurants in Vega$ so hit me up if you know of one I should try!

The burger and pizza was the only thing affordable. After spending $100 a meal each time, you just want to take a break and eat something more to your budget. 

Wolfgangs burger is the way to go. Great quality. Charred meat on the outside and medium rare on the inside. They even cut the burger in half if you wanted to share. 

Pizza was bland and tasteless. There was no flavor and it lacked salt. 

The service is superb, the burger was good for $17 but the pizza really sucked.
The prime burger, albeit overpriced was excellent.  Our service was very good too.

My husband and I were in Vegas for only three nights and we actually dined here twice.  The service is excellent.  The food is very good too.  I would recommend reservations for dinner for sure.

The salads are HUGE but you can ask for a half order (which I did the second time). 

Butter Lettuce Caesar: 5/5 - love that it has anchovies, Humboldt Fog Cheese, garlic croutons.  The texture of the butter lettuce has a great crunch without being too watery like green leaf can be (w/ the stem).

Chopped Vegetable Salad: 4/5 - it was a very hearty salad - similar to what veggies you would get in a Greek salad; includes Feta Cheese, Garlic Croutons, Creamy Greek Dressing

Sautéed Maine Crab Cakes:  5/5 - the textures worked really well together.  The crab cake had a crisp outside and full of crab on the inside; served with tomato relish, and a delicious basil aioli; just wished they had this as an entree.

Pizza - Prosciutto, Kalamata Olives, Oven Dried Tomatoes, Basil Pesto, Goat Cheese:  3/5 - the crust could be more crunchy and less soggy, but they really loaded the toppings on, especially the prosciutto.

Pizza - Spicy Sopressata, Salami Toscana, Pepperoni, Sausage, Red Onions, Goat Cheese, Jalapenos:  3/5 - big serving and lots of toppings, but the crust would be better if it weren't soft/soggy in the middle, but more crunchy.

This place is a must if staying at the MGM! The staff are very friendly and efficient. 
The bar has open seating which is great for stopping by to grab your favorite drink or meal. The restaurant seating is huge as well and there's great music so if you're looking for a nice dinner spot before you hit the casino or club floor, definitely give this place a try. 
The pearfect martini is incredibly refreshing & flavorful. If you have time for dinner, try the carmelized cauliflower and house made gnocchi. Both dishes are fantastic and just the right portion size. Even though those are the only two dishes I've tried, everything else I've seen looks equally impressive. 

I even received a coupon for a temporary membership to check out house recipes online!

This was a great place to visit on the whim (especially if you don't feel like having to dress all fancy like me) nice variety on the menu and everything was reasonably priced for being mr pucks food in the middle of mgm. I started with an awesome salad! I can't remember the name but It was the freshest most delicious caprese version salad I've ever had. I of course got the vegetarian ravioli (was a corn stuffed pasta) was iffy on ordering it at first but it was very tasty and flavorful. I'd definitely come back here again. Great food that doesn't empty your pockets (completely, it is Vegas)
The food was excellent and the service was even better. I ate from their holiday menu and it was delicious.

If you're in the mood for a great Vegas establishment with top quality food without the long pesky wait, or burning a hole in your pocket. this place is for you.

Very well priced, and great food selection. The onion rings are very delicious.

This restaurant has good food, good service and is actually pretty affordable.  Every year we go to a concert in MGM and try to make a reservation at a different restaurant every year.  We've always noticed how busy this place looks and have tried to get in before, but this year it worked out.  We made a reservation for 5:30pm before our 8pm concert on a Saturday night.  When we got there, the wait was already up to an hour.

We started off with a bottle of wine, Merlot, which was the same price as the half bottle we'd ordered the night before at another restaurant.  For dinner, I went with meatloaf and the hubby ordered the prosciutto pizza.  I wouldn't normally order meatloaf for dinner, but it sounded like a good option to go with the wine.  The food was pretty good.  

This would probably be my second favorite place of the MGM restaurants.  It is a good option for decent food at decent prices.

The food was awesome. Best salmon I have ever had. Our waitress Cassandra was excellent. The manager was very rude and unprofessional. We spent $230 on dinner and I had 2 glasses of wine. We were on our way to the KA show, and we were walking out of the restaurant  with my wine glass full of wine. The manager was rude and poured my $13 glass of wine in a plastic cup and laughed at us. I have been a waitress in this town for 25 yrs at casinos. Anytime a guest left the restaurant with a wine glass, the girls on the casino floor would return the wine glasses to the restaurant. I will tell all my friends about this bad experience and his youthful unprofessionalism .

Came for dinner. We chose to come here because it was the closest restaurant with a good variety of food at affordable (for Vegas) prices. The decor is modern and the tables are exposed to the casino floor but are comfortably far enough to not feel like your being watched by passers-by. We started with the beef skewers and calamari. The calamari was delicate and seasoned nicely. The breading could have used a tiny bit more crunch. The skewers were cooked to a perfect med-rare and still managed to have some char marks on the outside. Drawback, the meat is fatty and can be gristley and can't necessarily be bitten off the skewer without having to gnaw on it for a minute. Pretty embarrassing if your making out with a skewer in front of others because you're trying to pull off a bite. Best forego the skewer stick and use a knife and fork. I had the Chicken Jadori with cauliflower instead of mash pot. The chicken was delicious. It was an open, almost entirely deboned half chicken (only thigh bone), that was seasoned and broiled creating a wonderfully crisp seasoned crust that contrasted the juicy hot chicken underneath. The dish was great with texture, freshness and portion. The flavor was on point but about half way through gets a bit salty from the crisped seasoning. I was ok with it though. Very satisfied with what we ate.

Tried the sauteed Maine crab cakes with tomato relish and basil aioli, plus the Kombucha pumpkin agnolotti. Both were decent, reasonably portioned dishes, but resoundingly conventional in presentation and flavor.

Indeed, this particular restaurant opens directly onto the MGM casino floor, and is within eyesight of both Joel Robuchon as well as L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon. You just can't help wondering what marvels lie behind those doors, and then look at what you're having here and feel... unsatiated, in comparison.

The bright spot was the courteous, engaging bartender who served me. She knows her stuff and mixed quite a good pineapple mojito.

I was a little disappointed with the service, it was pretty slow for so late at night (approx 2am), but the food was good, albeit a little pricey for what you are getting. Two of my friends shared the brussels sprouts with bacon and a pizza, and they very much enjoyed those. I shared the roasted sweet potato with kale and the chopped vegetable salad, with the creamy greek dressing swapped out for chinese mustard vinagrette, and both dishes were very good. I do enjoy how accommodating they are to dietary restrictions, by allowing us to swap the dressings, and also having an entire gluten-free menu. All in all, a pretty good place, but I would try something new if I were back in the city.

Had a great dinner at Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Las Vegas inside the MGM Hotel on a Wednesday night.  We were able to get in with a 20 minute wait and they text you when your table is ready, so you can wander off and gamble.

Everyone was rushing around the restaurant like they were crazy, but it didn't seem particularly busy, just steady.  Our server was fairly attentive and everything was delivered quickly.  We were feeling pasta and I had the sweet fennel sausage bolognese while the husband had spaghetti and meatballs and both were delicious, although I have to say his spaghetti and meatballs were the better of the two.  The meatballs were so tasty yet had a delicate well made texture to them.  The bread that they serve is fantastic and warm.  My only disappointment was they were out of burrata and I REALLY was craving burrata and tomato salad... actually, I still am!

Overall, it was a good service, delicious food, reasonably priced and we were in and out pretty quickly.  Definitely recommend.
The food was very good and priced well, would have given 4 stars if the waiter had been a little more interested in his job rather than flirt with the hostess.

My friends I headed here immediately after exiting the Ka by Cirque Du Soleil show just across the way. It was around 8:30 p.m. on a Tuesday night and our wait for a table was about 5 mins. 

I ordered the Calamari & Mushroom and Truffle Pizza as our appetizers. Both were really good. The Mushroom with truffle pizza was the best pizza I've ever had. I also had a couple of Pineapple Mojito's and it was excellent. 

My entree was Wolfgang's Chinois Salad. Absolutely yummy however for $16, I expected it to be off the hook. Given the upscale feel of the restaurant and its ambiance, I guess paying $16 is a little justified.

This restaurant is a must try if you're ever visiting or staying in the MGM Grand Hotel.

Girlfriend and I stopped here for a late dinner. It's great knowing this place is open till 6AM and the food choices are great. We ended up sharing a margarita pizza and a side of Mac and cheese. First of all the Mac and cheese was god like. It was the best I've ever had, and definitely worth the 12$. The pizza however lacked character, it wasn't bad or anything, but it was just very simple. I thought they would put some spice to it, or try to make it their own like many other places but it was very simple. It was good, but I was expecting more from it. I ordered a Rouge Mocha Porter which was great, but it was just above room temperature so it wasn't very refreshing. My girlfriend ordered a raspberry lemon drop and she enjoyed it, she described it "good but strong" which can be a good thing or a bad thing haha. Overall I would enjoy eating here again on my next visit, very close to the west wing too!

I ordered a wood oven pizza with italian sausage, caramalized onions, smoked ricotta, and some other stuff on it. OMG. I couldn't believe what my taste buds were experiencing. I shared the pizza with my sisters and I secretly didn't want them to have anymore because I wanted it all to myself. A day and half later I ordered it again and finally I had all to myself. Usually when it comes to food I share what I eat. But when I'm here,that pizza makes me a greedy lil' bi**h. Last time my sister went to Vegas I made her get that pizza to go before she came home to L.A. It's that good :D

The food and service were both wonderful here! I've been to Vegas twice and eaten at this restaurant three times. The pizza was probably my least favorite but the BLT, chicken salad sandwich, and chicken noodle soup were all top notch. I would recommend this restaurant at the MGM!

This guy puts his name on anything and lures people in it seems.  The Wolfgang Cafe was OK.  Had the spaghettini and the chicken wing appetizer.  It looks like lamb at first, but it was actually a chicken bone with the meat pushed down.  They try hard, but the tastes are not hitting the spot.  I felt the service had room for improvement.  The food is not terrible here, its average.

Excellent Service

Very pleased wit our meals, I had Shrimp Scampi Alfredo Pasta,  My sis had Calamari.
My dish was a little to al dente for me so they re cooked it to my specifications.
The calamari was so good that my sis wanted to go back another day.

I came across this place and walked right in on a Monday afternoon. Lots of business looking people and im pretty sure we were the only Mexicans there. our server who i forgot his name (a nice, 20something Asian guy) was VERY sweet and checked in on us often.  My mom ordered the veggie pizza and chicken noodle soup as an app. Since I ordered the chicken, our server warned us it would take about 20 minutes since they need to make sure its fully cooked. My mom asked i wanted chicken noodle soup and i said no because its boring and im over it. When it came, i saw her soup looked pretty good so i tried  it and it was the most delicou un-boring soup with plenty of flavor. Her veggie pizza was okkkk but my chicken with potato puree was amazing and worth the wait!!!!! I only wished they served bread sticks or something with your meals.

Very pleasant Vegan meal experience! Great food, great service, couldn't have had a more convenient location as it was in our hotel lobby!

No wait to be seating for dinner around 7 pm...nice. We decided to share a pizza since we saw other tables and they definitely were large enough to split. We also ordered a salad and they were nice enough to split it for us!

We saved 2 slices of pizza for midnight munchies...best idea ever!! It really hit the spot after a long night of walking, gambling, and (responsibly) drinking.

We also ordered 2 sangrias, one white, one red, both delicious. In the end, as far as prices for Wolfgang and Vegas go, not too bad. This meal will still cost you a pretty penny but you can do more damage at other Vegas sit-down restaurants.

If you need a quick but descent bite before a show (which was what we needed) then I highly recommend this place to you! There is a food court in the hotel but it feels very food-court-ey so beware for that. You are on vacation, enjoy!!

Soooooo happy we had dinner here one evening!!!! Make reservations. I had the butternut squash ravioli. Made me dance in my seat a little  
The truffle chips were great too. We had the sauce on the side so we could dip

Crab cakes came out in a very tiny portion. They are bite size crab cakes with tiny pieces of crab for $20. The pizza was so so. Focaccia bread was very salty. I'm a Wolfgang fan but was not impress with this place. I'll stick to Spago and Cut.

Typical Vegas overpriced restaurant.  The food was great, but the prices were pretty high for what you are getting.  The pizzas are good and the service is pretty good as well.  I know high prices are expected in Vegas, but come on.

I have wanted to go to a Wolfgang Puck restaurant and now I did. I'd give it a 3.5 star rating. It was good, not great , casual and simple. I got the signature pizza which was really good I might add. It had a flat thin crust with great tasting olives...great flavor! . The waiter was a bit slow which kinda bummed me out.  I felt like there was nothing to wow me here but for some good food not a bad place. Convenient location.

We came here after seeing a show one night - we tried to get into Nobhill Tavern, but we were treated pretty rudely so we walked away and came to Wolfgang Puck. Best decision we ever made!

I had eaten here twice before but that was years ago. This time, I ordered the fresh mozzarella and arugula salad (without oranges) and the veal ravioli...both were DELICIOUS. The mozzarella was so fresh and creamy and the dressing on the arugula was really good. The veal ravioli was so tasty. 

This meal was by far better than the meal we had the next night at Crafsteak...and it was half the bill we paid at Craftsteak!

wolfgang puck is indeed a legend. i had the BEST crabcakes here. they were so tiny and topped with tomatoes and cilantro. the location is interesting, being in the middle of a casino, overlooking the slot machines/tables. but food is fantastic, no wonder he caters to celeb events.

From the first time I tried out Wolfgang Puck Bar and Grill out of convenience, I have been back multiple times! Wolfgang's service and food have been consistently good, which seems to keep some regular customers over the weekend. 

The bar is a one of the best seats in the house! The bartenders are always on top of everything where my water was always filled and the dishes were always ready to be peppered; top notch! Wolfgang is a nice restaurant, but still casual enough where they have items priced from $15-30 (including pizza, sandwich, pasta, fish, and burgers). 

-Dishes-

Linguine Pancetta with steamed clams: My go to dish at Wolfgang Puck Bar and Grill! I always order this dish when I drop by Vegas. It's flavorful and the balance between the clams and Pancetta makes this dish buttery good. 

Cesar Salad: Visually pleasing and tasty with the right amount of dressing.. One of the best Cesar Salad I have ordered, nom!

Burger and Fries: Burger layered to perfections; juicy meat with fresh buns! The fries are 'to die' for as well; no stale fries!

Tortellini Short Rib with Squash Puruee: This dish is a balance of the sweetness from the squash and heavier sauce versus the Short Ribs. It's great! This dish is a slightly lighter than other, which is a great option for a smaller stomach. 

Overall, great food with chic decor inside MGM!

WATCH OUT WOLFGANG

'Cause your executive chef Dustin Lewandowski just cooked me one of the most amazing freakin' meals I've had in recent memory.  I've eaten here years ago and found the food good, but not amazing.  However, on this night everything was spectacular.  

My osso bucco was so succulent I even dug the marrow out of the bone (nasty, huh?) and sopped up every bit of goodness with the creamy Parmesan risotto.  I couldn't help it though. Chef Lewandowski reduced me to a caveman discovering the primal joy of meat meeting fire.  

Even my friend's pan roasted chicken was incredible.  When was the last time you had roasted chicken that made you pause after the first bite to marvel at its juicy goodness?

I can't wait to go back.

It was the only place open and we were too hungry to go anywhere else !
They got our order mixed up first but the food overall was not bad! Try the crab cake I liked that the most.

Hubby and I had dinner here our first night since we're staying at the MGM Grand. Food and service were exceptional. Everything was freshly made right before being brought to your table. Will definitely be returning!

Underwhelming is the perfect way to describe this restaurant. It is located inside the MGM and has an open floor plan, so there is no intimacy to the meal. It is loud and you can see everyone walking by. I ordered the scallop special of the day which was served atop a white bean ragout for $45. The dish was unbearably salty, but I didn't send it back. My friend ended up getting sick later in the night from the same dish, and the rest of our party felt that their meals were average and overpriced. The highlights of the meal were the bread service and the professional waitstaff. With countless dining option in Vegas I see no need to come back to this restaurant which offers nothing exciting or different.

The hostess was nice when I walked in last night and I found a seat at the bar. The bartender greeting me as soon as I sat down and he asked if I would like to see a menu. Which I did. (Of course). 

It was Monday night football and they had more TV's then most of the other nice restaurants (some did not have one). I ordered an Kentucky mule, yummy!!! Made to perfection. I really wanted the spaghetti and meatballs but I went with the half roasted chicken. I asked for the sauce on the side. I don't have much to write about the chicken. I didn't have any appetizers either. The chicken was not as flavorful as I would expect. 

The reason I am giving the place 4 stars is for ambience, price was decent and customer service was awesome (the manager even came by to ask if I was good-could have complained on chicken but ahh it was all good- I did eat it but I was still hungry late on) 

I would recommend trying something else on the menu though.

The ambience is warm causal. Great decor. Love the pictures on the wall. The staff Dan and Dante were awesome  made your evenings memorable! 
The sea bass entree is to die for!
Very disappointed with the pork chop it was not cooked all the way bummer. We were asked to come back and get a free dessert ! 
Disappointed the tap beer ( draft) was not working it would have been nice to taste local draft beer . 
Will be back for the staff and the fish !
We tried their wings and mussels for appetizers; salmon and calm pasta for entree, everything is great and not pricy.

The hamburger and Vermont cheese was good, not great and several of my family needed to send theirs back, but all in all they took care of us and made sure everything was well then care of. I would come back here again but not go out of my way.

Hmnn, well it's convenient so 4 stars there. I was proud of the host for getting us through a group that was intent on taking a selfie near the rose wall or pillar (whatever it is) right by the entrance. 

Let's get right into the food. I ordered the butternut squash ravioli with pine nuts + the blue cheese potato chips (or whatever they are called). 

The chips were delicious, well worth $12 or so. Perfectly crisp chips with a generous amount of toppings and cheese. 9.1/10.

The ravioli, hmmnn, I'm not sure but I was a little thrown off bite by bite. There's balsamic in the dish but it's plated along with what I think is melted butter... sometimes you get a bite with too little and sometimes you'll get some with too much acidity. I'm conflicted of whether or not they should have garnished with the pine nuts or not as they sprinkle them in the middle... it's not too little that you ignore them but it's not so much that it's apparent it should be part of the dish. Overall the squash was really overpowered and also very minimal amount stuffed into them. I know because one fell apart and I saw how little came out. This dish I believe was $24 and I'll give it a 6.8/10

The server was really attentive until it came time for the bill, sat there for what seemed like an eternity although maybe he thought I wanted to enjoy my tea. 

I didn't get water, actually, not only did I not get water but everyone around me got water and a refill; I eventually had to ask. 

No spoon for my honey, which I thought was weird. I would have used the spoon that I got in my place setting but there wasn't one in there. 

Not sure I would come back. I wouldn't mind it if it was on someones agenda based on location convenience but there are a hundred other places I'll go first. 

The total for my bill after tip was $55. That includes hot team, the potato chips, and the pasta.

The ambience is a bit noisy and chaotic, but that is to be expected in a Vegas restaurant.  We had the blue crab cakes, delish, the gnocchi,  taste like Chef Boy AR Dee, and Margherita pizza, very bland. The waiter was great. He realized we weren't satisfied, so he bought us a dessert on the house. It was delish. The customer service raised this Yelp from a 2 to a 3!

6/10

It's pretty good food but the service was slow. When I came with my boyfriend, their oven was broken so after we spent time looking at the menu and deciding on pizza, we had to go back to the drawing board. That basically eliminated a third of the menu. We decided almost immediately that we wanted to skip to dessert but had to wait a while for the waitor to come back just to give us a dessert menu. Then my boyfriend wanted the chocolate soufflé but they were also out of that. The Crème brûlée was decent but not amazing and the ice cream sandwich was very good and creative. Also the cherry sunrise is a nice and tasty drink! Unfortunately we had to wait a while to get the check and then for the waitor to pick up the check as well. The bus boy was very attentive! We always had water in our glass.

I wish I would have found this spot earlier in my trip. I would have had all my late-night snacks (or more than a snack) here.
